I would look up the place that you want to

up to you to evaluate what you - what you
feel.

I personally don't want to take malaria pills
or use heavy deep bug spray because that stuff

going into my body that I don't want to pass

Other travel tips would be to make sure that
you are healthy, you're good, you've gone

to your recent checkup and everything looks
good, you're healthy so that you can continue

to travel and it's good to talk with your
doctor and tell them - tell him or her that
you are going to be traveling.

If you know you're pregnant, try to avoid
doing extra crazy adventurous activities that

could lead to you falling or getting hit hard
in the stomach, also have travel insurance

and make sure your travel insurance covers
you for being pregnant if anything happens
when you're abroad.

It's also good to see in the city you're staying
where the closest doctor's office or hospital
is just in case anything happens.
